ticket.title: qor:form select_many doesn't support has_many relationship

Region has_many :countries
Country belongs_to :region

Region has_many :countries
Country belongs_to :region
ticket.original-body-html:
resource :region do
meta :countries, :type => :select_many end

Region has_many :countries

Country belongs_to :region

ticket.title: ShaoShing Crop > Strict the crop area with fixed width
ticket.original-body:

( same for fixed height )

ticket.title: Way to render widget
ticket.original-body:
If I have two widgets in one group widget :sidebar_shoe_advisor, :group => :widget_asset do end
widget :events_sidebar_myasics, :group => :widget_asset do end when I use render_widget :sidebar_shoe_advisor, it creates #<Qor::Widget::ViewSetting id: 1063, template_bundle_id: 5, widget_name: "sidebar_shoe_advisor", widget_group: "widget_asset", ....>, but the widget_group value should be empty.
So I think we should use render_widget :widget => :sidebar_shoe_advisor to render a separate widget, use render_widget :group => :widget_asset to render a group widget.
ticket.latest-body:
If I have two widgets in one group widget :sidebar_shoe_advisor, :group => :widget_asset do end
widget :events_sidebar_myasics, :group => :widget_asset do end when I use render_widget :sidebar_shoe_advisor, it creates #<Qor::Widget::ViewSetting id: 1063, template_bundle_id: 5, widget_name: "sidebar_shoe_advisor", widget_group: "widget_asset", ....>, but the widget_group value should be empty.
So I think we should use render_widget :widget => :sidebar_shoe_advisor to render a separate widget, use render_widget :group => :widget_asset to render a group widget.
ticket.original-body-html:
If I have two widgets in one group
widget :sidebar_shoe_advisor, :group => :widget_asset do
end

widget :events_sidebar_myasics, :group => :widget_asset do
end
when I use render_widget :sidebar_shoe_advisor, it creates #<Qor::Widget::ViewSetting id: 1063, template_bundle_id: 5, widget_name: "sidebar_shoe_advisor", widget_group: "widget_asset", ....>, but the widget_group value should be empty.

So I think we should use render_widget :widget => :sidebar_shoe_advisor to render a separate widget, use render_widget :group => :widget_asset to render a group widget.

ticket.title: refactor filtered_scope out from resources_controller
ticket.original-body: * a module including all filter_scoped related methods * resources_engine will add a filter_scoped class method to all models * in resources_controller#index, we just do @resource_class.filter_scoped(params[:filter]) * we can simplify search_center_controller a lot
ticket.latest-body: * a module including all filter_scoped related methods * resources_engine will add a filter_scoped class method to all models * in resources_controller#index, we just do @resource_class.filter_scoped(params[:filter]) * we can simplify search_center_controller a lot
ticket.original-body-html:
• a module including all filter_scoped related methods
  • resources_engine will add a filter_scoped class method to all models
  • in resources_controller#index, we just do @resource_class.filter_scoped(params[:filter])
  • we can simplify search_center_controller a lot

ticket.title: Use kaminari instead of will_paginate in resources_engine
ticket.original-body:
https://github.com/amatsuda/kaminari
will_paginate rails3 branch hasn't been updated for a long time. Kaminari is better in rails3/ruby19 environment.
ticket.latest-body:
https://github.com/amatsuda/kaminari
will_paginate rails3 branch hasn't been updated for a long time. Kaminari is better in rails3/ruby19 environment.
ticket.original-body-html:
https://github.com/amatsuda/kaminari

will_paginate rails3 branch hasn't been updated for a long time. Kaminari is better in rails3/ruby19 environment.

ticket.title: Introducing Qor Resources Engine Search Center
ticket.original-body:
Search center is a integration view for multiple resources, I add this feature because of LACOSTE Customer Service admin, Which is also related to:
- https://theplant.lighthouseapp.com/projects/30780/tickets/214-customer-view - Single User View that someday Anatole mentioned.
Here are the listing of current behaviors
### You can search multiple resources the same time ###
![image](https://theplant.lighthouseapp.com/projects/30780/tickets/241/a/910294/2011-02-14_1007.png "image")
### Choose one of the row in result, It will show that records related info ###
![image](https://theplant.lighthouseapp.com/projects/30780/tickets/241/a/910295/2011-02-14_1008.png "image")
### Mount to any url you want, and choose whatever resources related ### @@@ search_center :at => "/catalogue", :resources => [:product, :color_variation, :color, :size] @@@
### If you get only one result, It show related info page directly ###
![image](https://theplant.lighthouseapp.com/projects/30780/tickets/241/a/910296/2011-02-14_1009.png "image")
Define related info like this:
@@@ resource :product do search_on :code, :name
index_attrs :code, :name show_attrs :code, :name, :gender, :made_country, :price write_attrs :code, :name
related :all_color_variations do |p| p.color_variations.order("color_code") end
related :all_sizes do |p| p.size_variations.map{|sv| sv.size}.uniq end
related :collection do |p| p.collection end
related :material do |p| p.material end
related :care_instruction do |p| p.care_instruction end
related :special_care_instruction do |p| p.special_care_instruction end
related :washing_instruction do |p| p.washing_instruction.washing_instruction_icons end
end
@@@
You can edit any record in the result page.
ticket.latest-body:
Search center is a integration view for multiple resources, I add this feature because of LACOSTE Customer Service admin, Which is also related to:
- https://theplant.lighthouseapp.com/projects/30780/tickets/214-customer-view - Single User View that someday Anatole mentioned.
Here are the listing of current behaviors
### You can search multiple resources the same time ###
![image](https://theplant.lighthouseapp.com/projects/30780/tickets/241/a/910294/2011-02-14_1007.png "image")
### Choose one of the row in result, It will show that records related info ###
![image](https://theplant.lighthouseapp.com/projects/30780/tickets/241/a/910295/2011-02-14_1008.png "image")
### Mount to any url you want, and choose whatever resources related ### @@@ search_center :at => "/catalogue", :resources => [:product, :color_variation, :color, :size] @@@
### If you get only one result, It show related info page directly ###
![image](https://theplant.lighthouseapp.com/projects/30780/tickets/241/a/910296/2011-02-14_1009.png "image")
Define related info like this:
@@@ resource :product do search_on :code, :name
index_attrs :code, :name show_attrs :code, :name, :gender, :made_country, :price write_attrs :code, :name
related :all_color_variations do |p| p.color_variations.order("color_code") end
related :all_sizes do |p| p.size_variations.map{|sv| sv.size}.uniq end
related :collection do |p| p.collection end
related :material do |p| p.material end
related :care_instruction do |p| p.care_instruction end
related :special_care_instruction do |p| p.special_care_instruction end
related :washing_instruction do |p| p.washing_instruction.washing_instruction_icons end
end
@@@
You can edit any record in the result page.
ticket.original-body-html:
Search center is a integration view for multiple resources, I add this feature because of LACOSTE Customer Service admin, Which is also related to:

  • https://theplant.lighthouseapp.com/projects/30780/tickets/214-custo...
  • Single User View that someday Anatole mentioned.

Here are the listing of current behaviors

You can search multiple resources the same time

Choose one of the row in result, It will show that records related info

Mount to any url you want, and choose whatever resources related

  search_center :at => "/catalogue", :resources => [:product, :color_variation, :color, :size]

If you get only one result, It show related info page directly

Define related info like this:

  resource :product do
    search_on :code, :name

    index_attrs :code, :name
    show_attrs :code, :name, :gender, :made_country, :price
    write_attrs :code, :name

    related :all_color_variations do |p|
      p.color_variations.order("color_code")
    end

    related :all_sizes do |p|
      p.size_variations.map{|sv| sv.size}.uniq
    end

    related :collection do |p|
      p.collection
    end

    related :material do |p|
      p.material
    end

    related :care_instruction do |p|
      p.care_instruction
    end

    related :special_care_instruction do |p|
      p.special_care_instruction
    end

    related :washing_instruction do |p|
      p.washing_instruction.washing_instruction_icons
    end

  end

You can edit any record in the result page.

ticket.title: Autocomplete control for Qor Form
ticket.original-body:
I imagine we could use it like this, And it is required for Lacoste Customer Service admin:
@@@ meta :type => :autocomplete, :collection => lambda{|owner, keyword, app| Order.includes(:user) .where("users.family_name LIKE :keyword OR users.given_name LIKE :keyword", :keyword => "%hello%") }, :item_label_method => :order_id_with_first_product_name_with_user_name_and_user_phone_number
@@@
Need a app/controllers/autocompelete_controller.rb to execute the lambda everytime the user type in text field, and return json to show as dropdown list for the text field.
ticket.latest-body:
I imagine we could use it like this, And it is required for Lacoste Customer Service admin:
@@@ meta :type => :autocomplete, :collection => lambda{|owner, keyword, app| Order.includes(:user) .where("users.family_name LIKE :keyword OR users.given_name LIKE :keyword", :keyword => "%hello%") }, :item_label_method => :order_id_with_first_product_name_with_user_name_and_user_phone_number
@@@
Need a app/controllers/autocompelete_controller.rb to execute the lambda everytime the user type in text field, and return json to show as dropdown list for the text field.
ticket.original-body-html:
I imagine we could use it like this, And it is required for Lacoste Customer Service admin:

meta :type => :autocomplete, :collection => lambda{|owner, keyword, app| 
  Order.includes(:user)
       .where("users.family_name LIKE :keyword OR users.given_name LIKE :keyword", :keyword => "%hello%")
}, :item_label_method => :order_id_with_first_product_name_with_user_name_and_user_phone_number

Need a app/controllers/autocompelete_controller.rb to execute the lambda everytime the user type in text field, and return json to show as dropdown list for the text field.

ticket.title: Publish: try retrieve_connection before establish_connection
rewrite Publish (Publish 3)
ticket.original-body: * based on versioning (prefer https://github.com/laserlemon/vestal_versions to https://github.com/airblade/paper_trail) * use lock? with lock we can ask user to resolve conflict when publish * unintrusive design, Publish as a middle man instead of insert callbacks everywhere * get #171 resolved
ticket.latest-body: * based on versioning (prefer https://github.com/laserlemon/vestal_versions to https://github.com/airblade/paper_trail) * use lock? with lock we can ask user to resolve conflict when publish * unintrusive design, Publish as a middle man instead of insert callbacks everywhere * get #171 resolved
ticket.original-body-html:
• based on versioning (prefer https://github.com/laserlemon/vestal_versions to https://github.com/airblade/paper_trail)
  • use lock? with lock we can ask user to resolve conflict when publish
  • unintrusive design, Publish as a middle man instead of insert callbacks everywhere
  • get #171 resolved

ticket.title: The deleted label still leave
ticket.original-body:
1.add a new category named "新产品“
2.add other new category under"新产品”，named "第二级产品".
3.add other new category under"第二级产品”，named "第三级产品".（image 1)
4.publish"新产品“，then both "第二级产品"and "第三级产品"are will be published.
5.edit"第三级产品",and there is a diffs list.(image 2)
6.delete "新产品”,then both "第二级产品"and "第三级产品"are will be deleted.
But,there still has "第三级产品"on the diffs page.
And "第二级产品"this label still leave.(image 3)

1.add a new category named "新产品“
2.add other new category under"新产品”，named "第二级产品".
3.add other new category under"第二级产品”，named "第三级产品".（image 1)
4.publish"新产品“，then both "第二级产品"and "第三级产品"are will be published.
5.edit"第三级产品",and there is a diffs list.(image 2)
6.delete "新产品”,then both "第二级产品"and "第三级产品"are will be deleted.
But,there still has "第三级产品"on the diffs page.
And "第二级产品"this label still leave.(image 3)

ticket.title: publish + resources_engine and other improvments
ticket.original-body:
Add a hook in publish to accept a list of 'visible' resources, so when app initialize, we can pass in the resources list of resources_engine. Visible means displayed on admin, the resource user can manage directly.
With that information, we can improve the auto publish algorithm used now:
1. if A belongs_to B, B is new, when you publish A, B should be published too (keep fk consistent)
2. if A has_many B, and B is in resources list, when publish A do nothing to B (because user can see B on admin pages, he can publish B by himself if he wish)
3. if A has_many B, and B is NOT in resources list, when publish A also publish B (if don't publish B also, user have no way to publish it because it's not in the resources list)
4. if A has_many C through B, auto publish B only when both A and C are published. e.g. if A is published but C is not, keep B unpublished. If C is published at a later time, publish B.
A graph search can be used to determine the dependencies of a publish, which can help user experience and avoid dead loop (there should be no circle in the graph). e.g. if user choose to publish A, we can know B and C need to be published automatically in advance, and give that information back to user, ask for his confirmation to avoid auto publish any sensitive data.
We should display a progress bar after user clicks the publish button.
ticket.latest-body:
Add a hook in publish to accept a list of 'visible' resources, so when app initialize, we can pass in the resources list of resources_engine. Visible means displayed on admin, the resource user can manage directly.
With that information, we can improve the auto publish algorithm used now:
1. if A belongs_to B, B is new, when you publish A, B should be published too (keep fk consistent)
2. if A has_many B, and B is in resources list, when publish A do nothing to B (because user can see B on admin pages, he can publish B by himself if he wish)
3. if A has_many B, and B is NOT in resources list, when publish A also publish B (if don't publish B also, user have no way to publish it because it's not in the resources list)
4. if A has_many C through B, auto publish B only when both A and C are published. e.g. if A is published but C is not, keep B unpublished. If C is published at a later time, publish B.
A graph search can be used to determine the dependencies of a publish, which can help user experience and avoid dead loop (there should be no circle in the graph). e.g. if user choose to publish A, we can know B and C need to be published automatically in advance, and give that information back to user, ask for his confirmation to avoid auto publish any sensitive data.
We should display a progress bar after user clicks the publish button.
ticket.original-body-html:
Add a hook in publish to accept a list of 'visible' resources, so when app initialize, we can pass in the resources list of resources_engine. Visible means displayed on admin, the resource user can manage directly.

With that information, we can improve the auto publish algorithm used now:

  1. if A belongs_to B, B is new, when you publish A, B should be published too (keep fk consistent)

  2. if A has_many B, and B is in resources list, when publish A do nothing to B (because user can see B on admin pages, he can publish B by himself if he wish)

  3. if A has_many B, and B is NOT in resources list, when publish A also publish B (if don't publish B also, user have no way to publish it because it's not in the resources list)

  4. if A has_many C through B, auto publish B only when both A and C are published. e.g. if A is published but C is not, keep B unpublished. If C is published at a later time, publish B.

A graph search can be used to determine the dependencies of a publish, which can help user experience and avoid dead loop (there should be no circle in the graph). e.g. if user choose to publish A, we can know B and C need to be published automatically in advance, and give that information back to user, ask for his confirmation to avoid auto publish any sensitive data.

We should display a progress bar after user clicks the publish button.

ticket.title: event generator
ticket.original-body:
We need great flexibility in controller/view level for Qor Event: I believe most events have different appearances. Two way to achieve this goal:
1. resources_engine like design: a EventsController responds to all requests for events, return different views based on complex logic 2. scaffold. Use a generator to generate scaffold of events flow, then you can customize as you wish
I'm going to walk on way 2, because it's extremely customizable, which is the first goal in Qor Event's case. Shared code will be put in modules/helpers.
ticket.latest-body:
We need great flexibility in controller/view level for Qor Event: I believe most events have different appearances. Two way to achieve this goal:
1. resources_engine like design: a EventsController responds to all requests for events, return different views based on complex logic 2. scaffold. Use a generator to generate scaffold of events flow, then you can customize as you wish
I'm going to walk on way 2, because it's extremely customizable, which is the first goal in Qor Event's case. Shared code will be put in modules/helpers.
ticket.original-body-html:
We need great flexibility in controller/view level for Qor Event: I believe most events have different appearances. Two way to achieve this goal:

  1. resources_engine like design: a EventsController responds to all requests for events, return different views based on complex logic
  2. scaffold. Use a generator to generate scaffold of events flow, then you can customize as you wish

I'm going to walk on way 2, because it's extremely customizable, which is the first goal in Qor Event's case. Shared code will be put in modules/helpers.

ticket.title: Add Another button
ticket.original-body:
Just after added a record, It redirect to Edit form of that record, It would be nice if there is a "Add Another" button along with "Update" button, So that you can continue adding new record, Don't need to go back to list, and click "Add new xxx" button.
NOTE, the button should only appear just after you added a new record? When you go list, and click a record to edit, It shouldn't show that button?
